intro: Diplostephium revolutum var. rubrum, commonly known as the red-stemmed spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red stems and yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
